note: Inputs for the k_calibration module. This module turns the dimensionless bounce scale (as produced by bounce_perturbations diagnostics in x=Mη units) into a CMB multipole estimate ℓ≈k χ_* under explicit assumptions. If out/bounce_perturbations/results.json exists, k_calibration will prefer that live output; otherwise it falls back to the values below.

cosmology_flat_lcdm.source: Planck 2018 base-ΛCDM (typical central values; for publication use the exact table/likelihood): H0=67.36, Ω_m=0.3153, Ω_r≈9.2e-5, z_*=1090

signature_policy.rationale: TFPT delivers transfer functions in k-space. The mapping to observable ℓ is a policy gate that depends on the expansion history (a0/a_transition). Under the current threshold-derived budget (see out_physics/k_calibration), scalar features land at ℓ_bounce^s≈57 (CMB low-ℓ), while tensor features are super-horizon (ℓ_bounce^t≈0.212). We therefore treat the signature class as conditional: CMB low-ℓ scalar vs small-scale-only depending on the declared history.
signature_policy.note: Declare a reproducible decision rule for classifying signatures (CMB window vs small-scale). Prefer CMB if there is any overlap with the [2, 2500] window.

fallback_bounce_diagnostics.source: fallback values copied from a reference run of bounce_perturbations (update by running the full suite)
